cheatsheet.title: Create a new nominal correlation analysis

intro.description: This type of analysis examines minimal correlations between nominal columns in a particular table and displays the results in a chart. It highlights weak relationships between pairs of data in order to indicate potentially incorrect relationships.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click the Analyses folder on the DQ Repository tree view and select New Analysis (or click the link below). Browse to and select Nominal Correlation Analysis in the wizard. The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description....). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can define the analysis settings.

item.title: Select the columns to analyse
item.description: Click the Analyzed Columns to open the corresponding view(or click the link below). Then click Select columns to open a dialog box in which you can browse to and select the nominal and interval columns to analyze.

item.title: Select the right data mining type
item.description: Next to each column, there is a corresponding Data Mining Type box. Select the relevant data mining type from the list.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: To execute the analysis, click the Run icon located to the top left of the editor (or click the link below). Alternatively, right click the analysis under the Analyses folder on the DQ Repository tree view and select the Run icon on the context menu.
